/* Ripening */  Add relevant remark from paper which did NOT make the erroneous claim about animals which see in the UV.
/* Ripening */  Removed tag I just added. It says "blue" in the referenced paper -- even though it clearly isn't just blue light! -- so just drop it.
/* Fruit */ reduce width of multiple image

/* Ripening */  I tagged this before, to no avail. Yes, the study may have ''said'' that, but it is patently incorrect! In order to see fluorescence you need to be able to see VISIBLE light (like we all can in that picture!), not the light (UV) that's exciting the fluorescence. That was a mistaken remark in the paper that doesn't need to be repeated.
/* Ripening */  Dubious: What I see is some fluorescence that looks white or pink. I think the blue must be from the UV light itself.
/* Production and export */ no reason for an important table heading to be in small font
